column8: Combining the results of 11 twin studies published between 1928 and 1986, comprising 195 MZ pairs and 255 same-sex DZ pairs, they report a proband-wise concordance rate of 78% for MZ twins and 29% for DZ pairs. The summary estimate of heritability was 63%. - https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14601036?
column15: Urine drug test for all drugs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3474887/

column8: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22881212 - says 0.35 for delusional experiences - not ideal but clearly it is non-zero and better than setting it arbitrarily; 0 because not known? - maybe set it to between schz and 0  - 10.1002/bsl.681 - according to one other article (doi/abs/10.1177/0706743717706347), this article showed that you can't find a heritability signal for delusional disorder, and there may not be one? - but my take was just that we don't know what the heritability is. ; ; seems clearly nonzero insofar as it has been shown to associate with schizophrenia risk https://academic.oup.com/schizophreniabulletin/article/42/4/975/2413885; "Reviews of genetic studies into delusional disorder [136, 137] have found that due to a lack of studies and various methodological difficulties, there has been no clear evidence for or against a genetic contribution to the aetiology of delusional disorder" http://eprints.whiterose.ac.uk/87019/2/Genetics%20of%20schizophrenia%20and%20other%20psychotic%20disorders%20-%20E%20Pepper%20and%20AG%20Cardno%20%28revised%20version%20submitted%29.pdf;

column15: Serum test - https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5639462/; Clinical criteria can be helpful too - https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29356973

column8: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17136562?dopt=Abstract; https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/3430520 ; https://www.personalizedmedpsych.com/article/S2468-1717(17)30020-0/abstract - There is a strong genetic predisposition to SLE, with 35 genes associated with the occurrence of the disease being identified in GWAS (including interleukin receptor associated kinase 1, HLA DR2 and HLA DR3), with a heritability of 0.66 [42][42]

column15: TSH - difficult because it's kind of a gold standard, but overall high - https://www.aafp.org/afp/2004/0515/p2415.html - "When used to confirm suspected disease in patients referred to an endocrine specialty clinic, the TSH test has a sensitivity above 98 percent and a specificity greater than 92 percent for the clinical and functional diagnosis"
